title: Describing People's Appearance
summary: Adjectives and phrases for describing physical appearance, including height, build, hair, and distinctive features.

sections.heading: Introduction
sections.content: In this lesson, you will learn how to use certain adjectives and words to describe people's physical appearance. We'll cover height, build, hair characteristics, and other distinctive features.

sections.heading: Height and Build
sections.content: Terms to describe a person's height and body type:

examples.example: My brother is very tall - he's 6 feet 3 inches.
She's quite short compared to her classmates.
Most people in my family are of medium height.
The dancer had a slim, graceful figure.
He became very thin after his illness.
The doctor said I'm slightly overweight.
You can tell he's fit from his muscular arms.
Many models today have curvy bodies.
My petite sister wears size small clothes.

sections.heading: Hair
sections.content: Describing hair by length, shape and color (in this order: length > shape > color):

examples.example: She has long straight black hair.
The boy with short curly hair is my cousin.
I prefer medium-length wavy hairstyles.
Many Scandinavian people have naturally blonde hair.
The brunette woman is our new manager.

sections.heading: Other Features
sections.content: Additional terms for describing distinctive appearance features:

examples.example: Does your father wear glasses?
He grew a beard during his vacation.
The man with a moustache is my uncle.
His face showed wrinkles from years of smiling.
The child had cute freckles across her nose.

sections.heading: Asking About Appearance
sections.content: Common phrases for describing and asking about physical appearance:

examples.example: 'What does your new teacher look like?' 'She's tall with short brown hair.'
My sister is five feet six inches tall.
The athlete weighs 180 pounds.
